Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with [count]+ E.G.O Gifts

tips.text: Should be achieved normally by doing MDs and getting lots of gifts.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 15+ Burn E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

WARNING: A fusion only counts as one gift, so fusing reduces your total number of gifts for that keyword. Make sure you can still reach 15 before fusing if you're aiming for this achievement. Because of this, they're not included in the list below.
If you plan to fuse Soothe the Dead, subtract 3 from your total Burn gifts count. If you plan to fuse Purloined Flame, subtract 2.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 15+ Bleed E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

WARNING: A fusion only counts as one gift, so fusing reduces your total number of gifts for that keyword. Make sure you can still reach 15 before fusing if you're aiming for this achievement. Because of this, they're not included in the list below.
If you plan to fuse Bloody Mist, subtract 3 from your total Bleed gifts count. If you plan to fuse Hemorrhagic Shock, subtract 2. Subtract 1 for the canto/intervallo fusions.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 15+ Tremor E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

WARNING: A fusion only counts as one gift, so fusing reduces your total number of gifts for that keyword. Make sure you can still reach 15 before fusing if you're aiming for this achievement. Because of this, they're not included in the list below.
If you plan to fuse Coupled Oscillation, subtract 2 from your total Tremor gifts count. If you plan to fuse Omnivibro-octovecti-bell, subtract 3.Subtract 1 for the TKT fusions.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 15+ Rupture E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

WARNING: A fusion only counts as one gift, so fusing reduces your total number of gifts for that keyword. Make sure you can still reach 15 before fusing if you're aiming for this achievement. Because of this, they're not included in the list below.
If you plan to fuse Enrapturing Trance, subtract 2 from your total Rupture gifts count. If you plan to fuse Ruin, subtract 3. Subtract 1 for the Nocturnal Sweeping fusion.

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

If you plan to fuse Lucky Pouch, subtract 3 from your total Poise gifts count. If you plan to fuse Cask Spirits, subtract 2. Subtract 1 for the canto/intervallo fusions.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 15+ Charge E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

WARNING: A fusion only counts as one gift, so fusing reduces your total number of gifts for that keyword. Make sure you can still reach 15 before fusing if you're aiming for this achievement. Because of this, they're not included in the list below.
If you plan to fuse T-1 Perpetual Motion Machine, subtract 2 from your total Burn gifts count. If you plan to fuse T-5 Perpetual Motion Machine, subtract 3. Subtract 1 for the MotWE fusions.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 10+ Slash E.G.O Gifts

tips.text: This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 10+ Pierce E.G.O Gifts

tips.text: This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 10+ Blunt E.G.O Gifts

tips.text: This should be doable on either normal or hard as long as you're able to get a few theme pack specific gifts. Don't forget to use fusion and keyword refresh.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with [count]+ Tier 4 E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
Try to get as many high tier gifts as you can and fuse them to get Tier 4s. It's very unlikely that you'll be able to get the amount needed from just shops and event/boss rewards.

While you can theoretically encounter 10 or even 20 tier 4 gifts on normal difficulty, it is unlikely (or completely unrealistic for 20) for you to be able to obtain that many. Expect to have to complete this achievement on hard.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with [count]+ Fusion Recipe-only Tier 4 E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
Try to pick theme packs that give you more chances for fusion gifts. Recommended ones are Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones, TimeKilling Time, Murder on the WARP Express, and Nocturnal Sweeping. Honorable mention to Miracle in District 20 BokGak.

The 10+ achievement is marked as hard only because it's unrealistic to complete it on normal.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 8+ Theme Pack exclusive Fusion E.G.O Gifts

tips.text: Try to pick theme packs that give you more chances for fusion gifts. Recommended ones are Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones, TimeKilling Time, Murder on the WARP Express, and Nocturnal Sweeping. Honorable mention to Miracle in District 20 BokGak.

Collection.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 1+ Tier 5 or EX E.G.O Gifts

tips.text:
You're most likely going to have to fuse Lunar Memory on hard mode to get this acheivement since the two EX gifts are very difficult to get.

In case you're unaware, this is how you get the EX gifts:
A Certain Philosophy: Fail a 99% chance fusion (You can get 99% chance by using starlight boost while fusing 3 items or by fusing 4 items in a super shop on hard)
Wealth: Succeed in the slot machine event.

Collection.text: Unlock 40 or more Normal Difficulty Theme Packs

tips.text: Should be achieved normally by doing MDs and picking new theme packs whenever they appear.

Collection.text: Unlock 70 or more Hard Difficulty Theme Packs

tips.text: Should be achieved normally by doing MDs and picking new theme packs whenever they appear.

Collection.text: Unlock 300 E.G.O Gifts in the E.G.O Gift Compendium

tips.text: Should be achieved normally by doing MDs and picking new gifts whenever they appear. Unfortunately there are too many hard only gifts for this to be achievable on normal, but this may change when the intervallo and other future events are released.

Clears.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher [count] time(s)

tips.text: Just keep running MDs and you'll complete this eventually especially if you grind intervallo/bokgak currency here instead of on the event stage. Try not to burn out. You have a lot of time until the next mirror dungeon.

Clears.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher [count] time(s) - every floor has to be in Hard Difficulty

tips.text: Running MDH once a week should be enough to get you most of the way there (or the entire way if the next season is delayed). If you're clearing the other hard only achievements, you'll probably finish this way before you complete everything else.

Clears.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon up to Floor [floor] once

tips.text: Clearing up to Floor 10 means completing MD Infinity, while clearing up to Floor 15 means completing MD Extreme. For F15, if you only want this achievement and not the 50 Adversity points one, then it's pretty much the same as finishing Infinity if you don't take any Adversities, just a little harder since you have to go further and pick more Mounting Trials. Otherwise, see the 50 Adversity points achievement in the 'Adversity - EXTREME' category.
Everything below was written prior to the release of Extreme which extended this achievement from F10 to F15.

This basically means clear to the end of MDI. There's way too many ways to clear it to actually recommend anything regarding team building. Just bring your strongest team do the best you can.

If you're struggling, there's a number of things that can help:
- Pick theme packs that have exclusive gifts for your team's main keyword(s). The fusions are especially useful, but the rest of the gifts are also good. Remember that you can choose theme packs using starlight now, so there's no reason for you to miss them.
- Buy more starlight buffs at the beginning of the run. They can make a massive difference.
- Avoid Refraction Railway theme packs. They add an additional +3 levels to all enemies on clear.
- Avoid difficult theme packs (e.g. The Dream Ending and The Surrendered Witnessing are particularly hard because you have to fight Sancho and possibly Jia Qiu) or theme packs that counter your keyword (e.g. Murder on the WARP Express for Bleed or Yield My Flesh to Claim Their Bones for Sinking).
- Try picking the least painful Mounting Trials at the end of every floor. Remember that 3 offense levels = 1 clash power. Picking +3 offense levels is better than picking +2 clash power. Also, unless you're using Sinking or have some other ways of reducing enemy SP, always avoid coin power.
- Aim to fuse Lunar Memory after you've gotten all the important gifts for your keyword. Potentially dealing up to 4x damage speeds up fights a lot and reduces chances for enemies to damage you. You also stagger them much faster, which makes high atk weight E.G.Os incredibly useful to stagger entire waves at higher floors.

Clears.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon up to Floor 10 10 time(s)

tips.text: See the 'Clear Mirror Dungeon up to Floor 1~10 once' achievement for tips if you're struggling with clearing MDI.

Clears.text: Clear 6 Refraction Railway related Theme Packs in a single Mirror Dungeon run

tips.text:
You're required to take Line #2 on Floor 4, but you're free to choose the rest in any order on the floors after that. You have a 1 floor leeway to choose whatever you want between F5-10, so you can choose a theme pack that will give you good gifts to help. Just remember that pushing the remaining RR packs back will also make them stronger.

Bring a team that can clash really well. RR theme packs give enemies an additional +3 levels on clear. This adds up quickly making enemies clash higher than usual especially on higher floors.

If you have weak AOE options, you might want to take Lines 4 and 5 earlier to deal with the envy peccatula while they're still weaker.

Clears.text: Clear 8 or more Story Theme Packs with Canto names in a single Mirror Dungeon run

tips.text: For the first 3 floors, you're required to take 'The Outcast', 'The Unloving', and 'The Unconfronting' in that order. The rest of the theme packs can be chosen in any order after that. You're free to take on up to 2 theme packs of your choice if you feel you need the exclusive gifts.

Loadout.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon Floor 5 using a Rental Team

tips.text: Self explanatory. Just clear normal or hard MD using a rental team.

Shop.text: In a single run, use the Shop Refresh function (including Keyword Refresh) [count] or more times and clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher

tips.text:
With the amount of cost you get on the higher floors on hard, this shouldn't be too difficult. Just remember that refreshes are disabled if you buy all the gifts and skill replacements in the shop.

If you're stuck in normal or struggling to get enough cost, try to do the following:
- Get starlight buffs that give you more cost or refreshes if you're struggling.
- You can buy starting gifts that give more cost or cheaper refreshes.

- Since refreshes cost more for each refresh you do in the same shop, try to even out the number of refreshes you do on each floor. The table below shows how much it would take to buy the refreshes in a shop. If you have the Pre-order Discount gift, doing 5 refreshes on each floor in MDI would cost about 158 per floor or 1580 in total, while doing 10 refreshes on each floor over 5 floors would cost 578 per floor or 2890 in total.

- Regular and Keyword refresh both count for 1 refresh, so avoid using Keyword refresh since it's expensive.
- You can aim for focused or Risky, Focused, or Abnormality encounters to get more gifts (to sell) and Cost, especially early on when they're still easier.

Shop.text: In a single run, purchase [count] or more E.G.O Gifts from Shops and clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher

tips.text:
If you're doing this on normal, you'll probably need to get the 'Star of the Beginning' and 'Binary Star-shop' starlight buffs to increase the number of gifts being sold in shops. Other than that, you mostly just need to do whatever you can to have enough Cost every time you enter a shop to buy out everything.

Pretty much any starlight buff that relates to Cost or gifts can help with this. More Cost means more gifts you can buy. Free gifts means more gifts you can sell to buy more gifts when you're short on Cost.

You can buy starting gifts that give more cost or cheaper gift purchases.

Don't be afraid to get repeat gifts from rewards if you don't need the other gifts. Except for the tier 1 vestige, the other vestiges generally sell for more Cost than other gifts of the same tier.

You can aim for focused or Risky, Focused, or Abnormality encounters to get more gifts (to sell) and Cost, especially early on when they're still easier.

Shop.text: In a single run, clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher while carrying [count] or more Enhanced E.G.O Gifts (Enhancement stage does not matter)

tips.text:
This one isn't quite as demanding with the amount of cost you need compared to the other shop achievements, but you still would preferrably do whatever you can to have enough Cost every time you enter a shop.

Remember that you have to clear the MD holding the enhanced gifts. If you fuse them after enhancing, they don't count.

The enhancement tier doesn't matter, so you can just enhance as many tier 1 and 2 gifts as you can to + instead of bringing them all the way to ++.

Try to get as many gifts as you can from event rewards. You can fuse gifts that can't be enhanced to get other random gifts that could potentially be enhanced or sell them to get more cost in shops for enhancements or to buy enhanceable gifts.

Pretty much any starlight buff that relates to Cost or gifts can help with this. More Cost means more gifts you can buy. Free gifts means more gifts you can sell or fuse when you're short on Cost.

You can buy starting gifts that give more cost or cheaper enhancements.

Don't be afraid to get repeat gifts from rewards if you don't need the others. The vestiges sell for more Cost than other gifts of the same tier. You can also fuse them with unenhanceable gifts to hopefully get enhanceable ones

You can aim for focused or Risky, Focused, or Abnormality encounters to get more gifts and Cost, especially early on when they're still easier.
The following is all enhanceable gifts currently available in MD.

Shop.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with [count] or more Cost

tips.text:
Similar to the other shop achievements, you're going to want to build up as much Cost as you can with Starlight buffs and Cost-related gifts. If you're doing this on normal, you're going to struggle a lot with the 3000 achievement, but on infinity you'll naturally get enough cost as long as you're not buying a lot from the shops trying to get the other achievements.

The same general tips from the other achievements to build up cost apply:
- Get Starlight buffs that give you more Cost or free gifts
- Buy starting gifts that give you more cost
- Get duplicate gifts when you don't need anything else because vestiges of tier 2 and up sell for a lot
- Aim for Risky, Focused, or Abnormality encounters, especially on lower floors when they're easier, to get more gifts and Cost

Shop.text: For 1 ally, replace all of their [skills] copies with Skill 3 in the Shop; then, clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher

tips.text:
Unlike the other shop achievements, this doesn't require too much cost unless you're really unlucky with shop refreshes. You just have to get lucky enough with the random sinner that appears in the shop skill replacement enough times in the same run.

Replacing all Skill 1s and 2s with Skill 3s requires exactly 5 skill replacements. On normal, you can only get 1 skill replacement per shop, while on hard you can get 1 per regular shop and 2 per super shop. This means if you're aiming to do this on normal, you're going to have to hope that the same sinner appears in the shop on every single floor. That is technically possible, but don't count on it. Replacing only skill 1s is more doable on normal but it will still require some really lucky rng. On hard, especially if you're doing infinity, you can aim to replace the skills of 2-3 sinners until one of them reaches the needed 5 replacements.

Ideally you'll refresh until you can buy all the skill replacements on the sinners you chose for this on every floor, but if you're going all the way to F10 on infinity, you can probably skip a few floors if you're really unlucky and running out of cost.

Shop.text: In a single run, use the Fusion function at least [count] times and clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher

tips.text:
Get as many gifts as you can, even those that don't really matter for your run. See the achievement on clearing while having up to 50 gifts for more tips on getting many gifts.

On the final floor you're aiming to do, fuse all the gifts you don't need to beat the boss. Fuse them 2 at a time to minimize the number of gifts you need and just keep fusing whatever you get with all the other gifts you don't need.

For 20 fusions, you only need at most 21 fodder gifts (including vestiges) to fuse. Less if you've already done other fusions for your team's keyword.

Shop.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with 0 Cost when exiting the Store on your final floor

tips.text:
This one requires a bit of math and luck to clear. If you're good with numbers or are lucky with refreshes, you can probably figure out a way to spend all your cost from just refreshing and buying gifts, but the easiest and most consistent way I've found is the following:

On the floor you're planning to end the run on, try to make sure you don't have too much cost to spend, but also not too little that you won't have many options on what you can spend on. You also need to make sure that some of your sinners are damaged or have less than 45SP. If you have a lot of Cost to spend, you may need to have a lot of your sinners damaged.

If you have any of the gifts that have a chance to refund Cost when enhancing or refreshing in a shop, sell them if you plan to use enhance or refresh.

If you want to make the numbers slightly easier to compute, you can also sell the gifts that give you 30% discounts on refreshes, enhancements, or skill replacements

Your goal is to buy/sell gifts, buy skill replacements, buy refreshes (both regular and keyword), and buy gift enhancements to make your cost a clean multiple of 100 (i.e. 100, 200, 300, etc). Ideally one that's not too high.

Once you hit that multiple of 100, you can spam the 'Heal Sinner' option until you have 0 Cost. This only works if you have damaged sinners or sinners at less than 45SP because the game disables the option if you don't. If you have only one damaged or sub-45SP sinner, spam the 'heal all sinners' option to give you more uses. Otherwise, always use the 'heal a specific sinner' option.

If you run out of sinners to heal but still have exactly 100 Cost, you can use the replace ids option to spend that last 100 Cost. If you still have more Cost, better luck on your next run.

Note: If you plan to finish on F5 and have infinite mode on, the boss will reward you with Cost when you beat it even if you decline to continue into F6. I'm not sure if this will invalidate the achievement, but you might want to turn it off just in case.

Combat.text: Deal [count]+ Skill damage against an enemy with a single Skill use (Shield HP dmg & dmg dealt On Hit such as Sinking Deluge or Time Moratorium counts; excludes dmg from Keywords and other sources)

tips.text: The achievement already tells you the two most straightforward ways to get this achievement: Sinking Deluge and Time Moratorium.

Sinking Deluge: Having the enemy at 99/99 Sinking will only deal 9801 Gloom damage, meaning you'll need an enemy that's either weak (x1.5) or fatal (x2) to gloom. For weak, Sinking Deluge will deal 14701 damage. The remaining 300 damage will have to be dealt with the damage from Spicebush's s3. For fatal, assuming you have 99 potency, you'll need at least 76 Sinking count for Sinking Deluge to hit over 15000, less if you count the damage from the s3. If you're going to use this strategy, avoid bosses that change phases since most of them have mechanics that counter this (Gasharpoon or Timeripper remove their statuses whenever they change phases, Dong Rang Who Denies All limits damage received before his phase change, Sancho ends turns early if she hits certain HP thresholds, etc). The most ideal bosses to do this on are Shock Centipede and Skin Prophet (or specifically his candles) since they can't die immediately and are both fatal to Gloom. Getting Lunar Memory is recommended if you want to be able to try this against other bosses to make them Gloom fatal.

Time Moratorium: This method is probably easier but slightly less predictable than the Sinking Deluge method. Your goal is to apply Time Moratorium on an enemy, deal as much damage as possible, then before the next turn ends, burst all the damage dealt with another Time Moratorium. This will deal 130% of the damage you dealt as Sloth damage, which means you need to have dealt about 11500 damage between the first and second Time Moratorium. It's recommended that you use Amplitude Entanglement with Reverb, Everlasting, and Scorch and Bursting as many times as possible during this time. Since the enemy's HP is locked, this method isn't as restrictive with bosses as the Sinking Deluge method, but it's still recommended to get Lunar Memory.

Strong AOE E.G.O (unsure): It might be possible to achieve this using a strong AOE E.G.O like Don's Yearning Mircalla or Hong Lu's Tears of the Tarnished Blood, but you'll need a lot of damage buffing E.G.O Gifts. You'll also need to do this in a fight with a lot of targets that don't die immediately like Skin Prophet's candles. Fights like the Railway Peccatula, Line 3, or Risky Encounters might also work if you pick up a lot of +max HP mounting trials.

Combat.text: In a single run, Clear Mirror Dungeon at Floor 5 or higher with all Identities at Level 80+

tips.text:
Make sure all your identities are max level, then buy the Favor of the Nebulae++ starlight buff, and get the gift Piece of Relationship++. This should be enough for everyone to reach level 80.

As far as I'm aware, these are the possible sources of levels in md:
- Base sinner levels: up to 55
- Favor of the Nebulae: +7 levels at F5, up to +15 levels at F10 at ++ tier
- Piece of Relationship: +5 levels at base, up to +10 levels at ++
- Abnormality Events: Dimensional Orbit Stabilizer (+2 levels), Bound King (+3 levels), Portrait of a Certain Day (+2 levels), Clockwork-time Roly-poly (+2 levels)

You can bring a lower tier of Favor of the Nebulae or Piece of Relationship if you get these events, but both are still required since the events only add up to +9 levels.

Note that this is theoretically possible to do on Normal, but I'm listing it as Hard only because you have to get unrealistically lucky to meet all the conditions (get all 4 events above plus Piece of Relationship by F5).

Combat.text: In an Encounter, have 7 Sinners Hit the main target Critically with all of their remaining Coins

tips.text: (Credit to u/ey_lamo on Reddit for their post on this) Apparently there's a mistranslation issue with this achievement. The actual achievement is to critically hit with all coins on the first turn while having 7 sinners. The easiest way to do this is to get the Ragged Bamboo Hat gift from the To Claim Their Bones theme pack and using Blade Lineage ids.

This guarantees that all Blade Lineage ids will crit as long as they have Poise. Since there are 6 Blade Lineage ids in the game, you only need to get one more Poise id, and having them crit on turn 1 shouldn't be too difficult. If you don't want to use all 6 Blade Lineage ids, there's a few other self-sufficient Poise ids that should be able to replace them without adding too much difficulty. Ideally bring ids with low coin skills that give a lot of Poise Potency. The following are a few example of ids that have skills like that:

Using E.G.O that give poise before attacking is also a viable option.

You'll also need some Poise granting gifts that can give Poise on turn 1 to make this more consistent.

Combat.text: In an Encounter, reach Clash Power 80 or higher

tips.text: Note that the methods below focus on getting this achievement with lower time, cost, and starlight investment. They rely solely on gifts for the relevant keyword and general damage type gifts. 80 clash power is much easier to reach if you get the starlight buffs that make getting gifts easier and get the various gift combos using other keywords. There are also methods using other IDs and E.G.Os that give Coin Power, but those won't be covered here.
The main option for this achievement is to use The Thumb East Capo IIII Meursault and put together the following:

cells: S3 with Savage Tigermark Rounds (5 coins)

+3
+2 from conditional
+2 for 3rd-5th coins from passive

Total without Accumulated Past: 76
Total with Accumulated Past: 81

tips.text: The remaining Clash Power can be gotten from more general gift sources.

I managed to do this at F7 with the following gifts (ignoring the irrelevant ones). I used Crushbound Past on turn 1, Regret on turn 2, then I just defended and clashed with weak skills (to not kill the boss) for a few turns. Meursault has to be deployed first for Darkflame Smoking Pipe to affect him. Accumulated Past is only at 8 stacks here, so there's even more leeway.

A possible alternative is using Charge. The problem is that most of Charge's Clash Power comes from Offense Levels instead of raw Base/Coin/Clash Power, so if enemies have too high Offense Level (from mounting trials or just from higher floors) they might end up cancelling out the Clash Power bonuses that Charge can get. The following is a list of most of the Charge skills with 4-5 coins (W Meursault's S3 and R Hong Lu's s2 have even lower numbers). Apologies if I have missed or added some numbers wrong (Clash Power won't be exact because of the differing Offense Levels, but the numbers I put should roughly be in that ballpark):

cells:
W Don S3 (5 coins)
W Ryoshu S3 (4 coins)
W Outis S3 (4 coins)
R Heathcliff S3 (5 coins)
R Ishmael S3 (4 coins)
Multicrack Faust S3 (4 coins)
Multicrack Heathcliff S3 (4 coins)

+2, +4 from conditional
+2, +5 from conditional
+3, +2 from conditional
+2, +2 from conditional
+6
+3, +4 from conditional
+2, +2 from conditional
+1 if id has a Gloom skill

W Don S3 Total: 79
W Ryoshu S3 Total: 74
W Outis S3 Total: 68
R Heathcliff S3 Total: 70
R Ishmael S3 Total: 69
Multicrack Faust S3 Total: 79
Multicrack Heathcliff S3 Total: 73

tips.text: As you can see W Don and Multicrack Faust are pretty close to the numbers required, so they theoretically can meet the requirements as well. However, unlike the Tremor method with Capo Meursault (assuming you don't use Accumulated Past), this method needs a long ramp up with everyone spending lots of Charge to get the Offense Level bonuses from the gifts so you'll need to aim for long fights like Railway fights or Jia Qiu from 'The Surrendered Witnessing', and if you do this on an early floor before enemies have too high Offense Level, they might not survive long enough for the ramp up.

Combat.text: In a Mirror Dungeon boss fight at Floor 5 or higher, activate the effect of Imposed Weight E.G.O Gift after 2 turns, then clear the Encounter

tips.text: You can achieve this by only bringing one sinner for that boss. (Thanks to u/TheParentheticals on Reddit for confirming)

If you're struggling with the solo you can bring either bring Fell Bullet Yi Sang with anyone else and kill them or bring a strong id with ids that can retreat (Family Heirarch Candidate Ishmael, Devyat Rodion, or Devyat Sinclair) and have them retreat.

Combat.text: In a single turn, equip 7+ Skills with different types of Sin Affinities at once

tips.text: Just make sure to bring all the sin affinities. You can try doing this in one of the longer unfocused encounters to build up more moves per turn to make this easier.

Combat.text: In an Encounter, reach a Speed value of 20 or higher with a Sinner

tips.text: There's a chance of this happening naturally using the Mao Heishous on a Rupture run if you have Smoking Gunpowder, Fluorescent Lamp, and Shadow Bamboo Hat.

You can try soloing a fight to concentrate Smoking Gunpowder's buffs on one person if it doesn't work out.

There are also some other gifts that can help like Resolution, Scalpel, Ancient Effigy, Harpoon Prosthetic Leg. 20 speed becomes fairly common when you have these gifts as well.

Combat.text: Raise 1 enemy's Burn Potency to 99 (in Focused Encounters, a Part)

tips.text: This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Burn gifts.

Combat.text: Raise 1 enemy's Bleed Potency to 99 (in Focused Encounters, a Part)

tips.text: This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Bleed gifts.

Combat.text: Raise 1 enemy's Tremor Potency to 99 (in Focused Encounters, a Part)

tips.text: This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Tremor gifts.

Combat.text: Raise 1 enemy's Rupture Potency to 99 (in Focused Encounters, a Part)

tips.text: This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Rupture gifts.

Combat.text: Raise 1 enemy's Sinking Potency to 99 (in Focused Encounters, a Part)

tips.text: This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Sinking gifts.
This will happen naturally on longer fights when you have most of the Poise gifts.

This will happen naturally when you have longer fights in the later floors of MDI, but may be harder to do in normal or on lower floors. Use Charge ids that can consume large amounts of charge at a time like QoH Don, Kod Rodya, W Ryoshu, or W Outis. If you're doing this on normal, try soloing to give that id more time to ramp up their Charge Potency.

Combat.text: Kill 7+ enemies with a single Attack Skill use in an Encounter (Enemies must be alive when the attack starts; can use E.G.O Skills)

tips.text: Go to the Full-Stopped by a Bullet theme pack at F4 (normal) or F3 (hard). Use Don's Yearning-Mircalla or corrode Hong Lu's Tears of the Tarnished Blood when there are 7+ enemies on screen. Honorable mention to Meursault's Crushbound Past if you can get an enemy to trigger his bonus atk weight. Other AOE E.G.Os can also achieve this, but will likely be less consistent.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Level Boost' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Level Boost appears on every floor from 11-15 and gives all enemies +3 levels each time if taken.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Frailness' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Frailness appears on every floor from 11-15 and reduces the max hp of all sinners by -10% each time if taken.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Mark of Fire' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Mark of Fire appears on floors 11 and 14 and deals fixed hp damage to all sinners at every turn end if taken. Mark of Fire on F11 I deals 5 damage on turn 1, increasing by 3 every turn up to a max of 20. Mark of Fire II on F14 deals 10 damage on turn 1, increasing by 5 every turn up to a max of 30.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Inflation' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Inflation appears on floors 11 and 13 and increases the costs of all Shop functions (Skill Replace, Buy Gift, Heal Sinners, Enhance Gifts, and Replace Sinners). Inflation I at F11 doubles all costs. Inflation II at F13 triples all costs.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Ego Interference' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Ego Interference appears on floors 11 and 13 and increases the costs of using E.G.Os. Ego Interference I doubles all costs and Ego Interference II triples them.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Mental Psychosis' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Mental Psychosis appears on floors 12 and 15 and reduces the SP of all sinners at the end of every turn. Mental Psychosis I on F12 is -3SP every turn. Mental Psychosis II on F15 is -5SP every turn.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Nerve Acceleration' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Nerve Acceleration appears on floors 12 and 15 and raises the min and max speed of all enemies. Nerve Acceleration I on F12 raises speeds by 1. Nerve Acceleration II on F15 raises speeds by 2.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'SP Fatigue' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

SP Fatigue appears on floors 12 and 15 and stops SP healing from going above a cap in battles (healing in the Shop can still reach 45SP). SP Fatigue I on F12 caps SP healing to 35. SP Fatigue II on F15 caps SP healing to 30.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Tremor Barrier' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Tremor Barrier appears on floor 13 and removes the first Stagger Threshold on all enemies.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Vitality Boost' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Vitality Boost appears on floor 14 and increases the max HP of all enemies by 30%.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with 1 or more 'Brutality' Adversities

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Brutality appears floor 14 and gives all enemies +2 Plus Coin Power and -2 Minus Coin Power.

Adversity - EXTREME.text: Clear Mirror Dungeon with [count] or higher Adversity Score

tips.text:
Adversities only exist on Extreme difficulty at F11-15.

Each adversity has a corresponding score attached to it. Your final adversity score is the sum of all the Adversities you took throughout your run. Hitting 50 requires you to take every Adversity on every floor.

The maximum Adversity Scores you can reach on each floor are as follows:
This means if you only want to partially clear this achievement, you only need to complete the corresponding floor if you pick enough Adversities (F11 for 5, F12 for 15, and so on).

If you want to complete all the way until 50, then get ready for highly difficult encounters where enemies can easily one shot you and your highest rolling EGOs are hopeless. A few things to remember:
- Take all the Starlight buffs at ++ if you can afford it. You'll need all the help you can get.
- Bring easily accessible HP and SP healing. You might struggle to survive the longer fights without it.

- Be careful of the order in which you pick the theme packs and also which ones you decide to skip. Some have harder fights that are better done early compared to others. The Clear All Cathy pack (Impenetrable Path) is particularly nasty because the Peccatulum Iraes have unavoidable counters that will stagger or outright kill your sinners if you're not resistant to them.

cells: N Corp. New League of Nine Litterateurs
Ahab Trio, Nelly, Jia Huan + Gubo
Ambling Pearl, Ardor Blossom Moth, Spiral of Contempt
You Want To Get Beat? Hurtily?, Shock Centipede, My Form Empties
WARP train and La Manchaland Bloodbags

tips.text: - Try to have your entire build established by F10. You won't be able to buy a lot of things on F11-15 because of Inflation, and if you have sinners dying regularly or using a lot of EGOs, you'll end up spending most of your Cost on heals (unless you managed to pick up Faith).
- Take the level up option on events that can level you up. Pick up Piece of Relationship as well if possible. You will need all the help you can get when you're clashing on the higher floors.

- Do NOT limit yourself to gifts of one keyword. Bring hybrid keyword identities that can make use of gifts for other keywords. All the better if you can trigger fusions for multiple keywords. Just don't overdo it to the point where the team itself is negatively affected because you're trying to force in an extra keyword. Get all your main keyword/s' gifts early and make sure you don't miss theme pack specific gifts and fusions. After that, get all the gifts you can for your damage types and secondary keywords (and Lunar Memory). They will make a big difference in how powerful your team is. Make sure not to fuse gifts of your secondary keyword if you don't have 5+ sinners to activate them.

- To add to the previous point, there are also many gifts or gift combinations that can help even when you're not using ids of that keyword. Artistic Sense can give you bonus damage. The Sin Fragments increases the power of EGOs. Red-Stained Gossypium can apply offense and defense level down when combined with a Bleed source like Rusted Muzzle. Melted Eyeball and Bell of Truth can apply offense and defense level down and fragile for free with Downpour. Charge-Type Gloves can give additional buffs with gifts like Wrist Guards. Clear Mirror, Calm Water can give a lot of free damage and offense level up with gifts like Nebulizer, Pendant of Nostalgia, and Ornamental Horseshoe. Try reading the descriptions of gifts you're not too familiar with to make sure you haven't missed anything.
- Having 30 max SP means rng can hurt you badly. Don't forget you can reset a stage when things don't go your way as long as you still have living sinners.

- Don't forget you have Durante abilities. Superbia isn't very useful later on since you should have more than enough EGO resources, but Pigritia and Morositasis especially could help in certain circumstances.

Completionist.text: Complete all Achievements (Not counting Achievements in the "Hidden" category)

tips.text: Not much to say here other than good luck!

You can't really plan for the hidden bosses since they come up randomly in Extreme event nodes. Just do what you normally do to prepare for extreme. You should be able to deal with them if you have good enough clashing and damage and if you deal with their mechanics where necessary.

For Don Quixote, just defend with everyone when he throws the gondolas at you. Heal often if you get hit with a lot of bleed. He has a lot of hp "checkpoints" so you'll end up skipping a lot of his mechanics if you deal enough damage.
If you beat him, you'll get "The Family's Resentment".

You can't really plan for the hidden bosses since they come up randomly in Extreme event nodes. Just do what you normally do to prepare for extreme. You should be able to deal with them if you have good enough clashing and damage and if you deal with their mechanics where necessary.

For Lei Heng, the biggest problem most players had in story mode was the amount of damage he dealt from his red coins due to his ammo and speed passives. Most builds that will survive extreme will probably naturally have sources of haste/bind in their gifts, which already eliminates his speed issue. Try clashing his weaker skills with your faster sinners to make him use up his ammo so he runs out before his stronger skills.
If you beat him, you'll get "For the Capo".

You can't really plan for the hidden bosses since they come up randomly in Extreme event nodes. Just do what you normally do to prepare for extreme. You should be able to deal with them if you have good enough clashing and damage and if you deal with their mechanics where necessary.

There's not really much to say about Ricardo. You just have to outclash him. He gets offense level buffs when you hit him or his minions, but at that point in extreme that doesn't really make that big of a difference and it's not really something you can control very well. You can use egos to make yourself resistant to his counter if you want to minimize damage.
If you beat him, you'll get "Rules of the Middle".

You can't really plan for the hidden bosses since they come up randomly in Extreme event nodes. Just do what you normally do to prepare for extreme. You should be able to deal with them if you have good enough clashing and damage and if you deal with their mechanics where necessary.
Sorry, I haven't fought him since the April Fool's event, and I haven't encountered him in MDE yet, so I don't know what he does.
If you beat him, you'll get "Kkomi's Mini-Gift".

Hidden.text: Obtain EX-Tier E.G.O Gift "A Certain Philosophy"

tips.text: You need to fuse with a 99% chance to get the keyword you want and fail it to get this gift. Just keep fusing either 3 gifts with the starlight buff to increase the fuse chance or with 4 gifts in a super shop.
You need to encounter the slot machine event and succeed in the 1% chance to get this gift.
